result.execSummary:
The defendant Alejandro J Cervantes was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: with Huber privileges for actual work and 11 days credit.

miscConds.notes: Pay a fine of $50 plus mandatory costs, assessments, DNA surcharge and surcharges or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant.

No violations of the criminal law rising to the level of probable cause.
Do not use or possess illegally controlled substances.
AODA, treatment or program. Random urine screening.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alejandro J Cervantes

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Bail Bond Refund Packet
1/27/16 bail refund notice/affidavit mailed to surety.

Sentencing proceeds.  Statements by counsel.  

COURT ORDERS defendant to serve 6 months at the House of Correction with Huber privileges for actual work and 11 days credit.  COURT STAYS the sentence and places the defendant on probation for a period of 1 year.

CONDITIONS:  1) no violations of the criminal law rising to the level of probable cause; 2) pay a fine of $50 plus mandatory costs, assessments, DNA surcharge and surcharges or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant; 3) do not use or possess illegally controlled substances; 4) random screening; 5) AODA, treatment or program; 6) perform 10 hours of community service. 

COURT ORDERS:
- defendant to pay the DNA surcharge.. 

Appeal rights given.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Pretrial Incarceration Credit  received and filed.  Copy given to the defendant.

Court denies defense motion for expungement.

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Amended Information and enters a judgment of conviction.

Defendant Alejandro J Cervantes in court with attorney Daniel E Meylink.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Amended Information received and filed.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of a copy of the Amended Information and waives reading.  Court AMENDS the charge to Possession of Tetrahydrocannabinols (THC) 961.41(3g)(e) a misdemeanor.

Defendant Alejandro J Cervantes in court with attorney Daniel E Meylink.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defense has received a new offer and needs time to speak with the defendant.  Case passed to the afternoon.
Justice Point report dated 1-21-16 received and filed./ds

Defendant Alejandro J Cervantes in court with attorney Daniel E Meylink.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defendant is in compliance with monitoring.   Court reschedules the final pretrial and jury date.  Pretrial scheduling order received and filed.  Final pre-trial scheduled for January 22, 2016 at 09:00 am.  Jury trial scheduled for January 26, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Justice Point dated 12-9-15 received and filed./ds
Court would like case set earlier for a scheduling conference.  Case set for 12-10-15 at 1:30 p.m., Br. 44./ds
Per Chief Judge Directive 15-19, case is judicially transferred to the Honorable Daniel Konkol.
Jury trial at 02-24-2016 09:30 am
Final pre-trial at 01-13-2016 01:30 pm

Defendant Alejandro J Cervantes in court with attorney Daniel E Meylink.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Matter is scheduled for plea and sentencing hearing today. Matter is now in trial posture.  Final pre-trial scheduled for January 13, 2016 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for February 24, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Justice Point Violation Report, filed.
Defendant Alejandro J Cervantes in court with attorney Daniel E Meylink.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Report, filed.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Alejandro J Cervantes in court with attorney Daniel E Meylink.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Milwaukee County Pretrial Services Violation Report, received and filed. Court admonished the defendant. Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 7.   All parties notified as of August 03, 2015 this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35, in room 629 of the courthouse.  Status conference scheduled for 08-11-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Alejandro J Cervantes in court with attorney Daniel E Meylink.  Nathaniel Adamson for Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Thomas McAdams, Branch 07.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 07.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 6/10/15.

15RM028158  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
06-06-15

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  

DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.  

NO possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  

Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Alejandro J Cervantes in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Defendant Alejandro J Cervantes in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Certified records not attached to criminal complaint as stated in the complaint; the Court orders the state to provide said records or strike criminal complaint.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 11, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
